decision_conditions: The amendment to the approved application listed below is considered to be of a minor nature and acceptable in its own right and not require resubmission of a fresh planning application.
The following amendment is deemed to be accepted:

- Removing the overhanging fascia adjacent to the unattached neighbour and infilling with additional brick work up to the boundary and using a sit on/ hidden gutter detail adjacent to No.90 Fairholme Avenue.
- Alterations to the fenestration on the first floor rear extension, replacing the patio doors and juliette balcony to provide one window and a smaller set of patio doors and juliette rail.

The applicant is advised that this amendment relates solely to the item detailed above and shown on drawings with proposed front and rear elevations and the first floor plan in respect to the changes to the fenestration on the first floor rear extension and the provision of additional brick work for the hidden gutter detail received on 02nd May 2019 and not to any other deviation from the approved drawings. Furthermore this amendment does not in any way alter or remove any previous conditions imposed on the original approved application reference P1588.17.

The applicant is advised that this planning permission does not give consent for any part of the development including guttering and fascias to encroach onto any land not within the applicant's ownership.
description: Minor amendment to P1588.17 - Inset guttering on boundary wall line between 88 & 90 to allow building on, or near as possible to the boundary/party wall line. Add window on second storey part extension by moving Juliet balcony to the left looking at the house from the garden.
